description: Metrics about the MQ Appliance hardware

panels.description: The current local date and time on the appliance.
panels.title: Date/Time

panels.description: The name of the time zone currently in effect.
panels.title: Timezone

panels.description: The total amount of time the appliance has been up since the last reload or reboot. Note that a shutdown and reload resets this counter.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: The total amount of time since the last reboot. Note that this counter is reset by a shutdown and reboot, but not by a shutdown and reload.
panels.title: Boot Up Time

panels.description: The type of the firmware installation type. Can be primary or secondary. The secondary firmware image is used when rolling back the firmware.
panels.title: Type

panels.description: The current local date and time on the server running the Prometheus exporter.
panels.title: Exporter Date/Time

panels.description: The version of this firmware image.
panels.title: Version

panels.description: The level of the firmware.
panels.title: Level

panels.description: Delivery type of the firmware.
panels.title: Delivery Type

panels.description: The specific build of the firmware image.
panels.title: Build

panels.description: Date of the firmware build.
panels.title: Build Date

panels.description: Date that the firmware was installed.
panels.title: Install Date

panels.description: The number of times the firmware image was restarted through an appliance reboot or a firmware reload. The count is from the initial firmware load on the appliance till the current time. The count is independent of firmware version.
panels.title: Boot Count

panels.description: The name of the time zone currently in effect on the server running the Prometheus exporter.
panels.title: Exporter Timezone

panels.description: The exporter version number of the Prometheus exporter.
panels.title: Exporter Version

panels.description: The serial number of the appliance. This number is unique to each appliance.
panels.title: Serial #

panels.description: The IBM machine type of the appliance.
panels.title: Machine Type

panels.description: The IBM model type of the appliance.
panels.title: Model Type

panels.description: Whether intrusion has been detected in the appliance.
panels.title: Intrusion Detected

panels.description: HA status of the appliance if the appliance is part of an HA group
panels.title: HA Status

panels.description: Appliance name of the HA partner and its associated status
panels.title: HA Partner

panels.description: Current total CPU usage on the appliance
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: CPU load average for 1, 5 and 15 minutes
panels.title: CPU Load Avg

panels.description: CPU temperatures over time
panels.title: CPU Temperatures

panels.description: CPU temperatures over time
panels.title: CPU Temperatures

panels.description: CPU usage overtime.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Total number of existing failure notifications.
panels.title: Failures

panels.description: Failures that have been notified.
panels.title: Failure Notifications

panels.description: RPM for fan 1
panels.title: Fan 1 RPM

panels.description: RPM for fan 2
panels.title: Fan 2 RPM

panels.description: RPM for fan 3
panels.title: Fan 3 RPM

panels.description: Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) System Event Log (SEL) events that the Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) collected.
panels.title: IPMI SEL Events

panels.description: The list of log targets currently defined and in use on this appliance

panels.title: Log Targets

panels.title: Total Events Processed

panels.description: The total number of events pending for all  log targets
panels.title: Total Events Pending

panels.description: The total number of events dropped for all  log targets
panels.title: Total Events Dropped
